description.narrative: Funding to support the Accreditation and assurance processes for Australian NGOs as part of the Australian NGO Cooperation Program (ANCP). Accreditation of Australian NGOs is a front-end and rigorous risk-management process, which is also a robust due diligence process for DFAT. To receive funding under the ANCP, ANGOs must be accredited by DFAT. To gain Accreditation Australian NGOs undergo a thorough and independent assessment of their organisational structure, philosophies, policies and practices. Accreditation is also used as a prerequisite for other NGO funding streams within DFAT. The assurance activities will assess and monitor compliance with the ANCP Annual Grant Agreeement. The ANCP has contributed to sustainable economic growth and poverty reduction in some of the world's poorest countries. The total estimated value of this investment is $0.77 million to be expensed in the 2019-20 financial year.
